title: Business Live: Pound slips - BBC News
summary: tesco to pay £ 129m in sfo deal .
mps examine rights of agency workers and the gig economy .

documents.title: good night
text: good night from the business live page .
enjoy your evening and join us again for more action tomorrow .

documents.title: consumer data lifts wall street
text: us shares recorded healthy gains on tuesday , with financial and energy shares surging .
it came after data showed american consumer confidence at a more than 16-year high .
the benchmark dow jumped 150 points , or 0.7 % , to 20,701 .
the wider standard & poor 's 500 index climbed 17 points , or 0.7 % , to 2,358 .
and the tech-based nasdaq increased 34 points , or 0.6 % , to 5,875 .

documents.title: mexican conglomerate to buy us freight company
text: mining firm grupo mexico has agreed to buy the florida east coast railway freight company for $ 2.1bn despite cooling trade ties between mexico and the us .
the firm - one of the world 's largest copper producers - is a leading player in mexican freight , and has benefited from the huge volume of trade that passes between countries .
however , it appears unfazed donald trump 's threats to renegotiate the north american free trade agreement ( nafta ) and place border taxes on certain mexican products .
in a statement to the mexican stock exchange , grupo mexico said the .
florida east coast railway was `` a unique and irreplaceable asset with 565 miles of track that offers rail services along florida 's east coast '' .
the purchase is subject to government approval .

documents.title: french presidential candidates pitch to business
text: frontrunners in france 's presidential election have talked economics with business leaders .
sophie fay is business editor at the french weekly magazine nouvel observateur , and watched the candidates make their pitches .
hear her takeaways on world business report :
listen : french presidential candidates pitch to business leaders via @ twitterid

documents.title: gm rebuffs einhorn 's idea for shares split
text: david einhorn 's hedge fund greenlight capital has called on carmaking giant gm to split its common stock into two classes .
he is also calling for four new directors to be appointed by gm .

but gm rebutted the proposals , and said that after considering einhorn 's ideas for seven months , it had decided that it would create `` unacceptable risks and is not in the best interests of shareholders '' .

documents.title: 'energy bills outstrip inflation by 10 % 'the sun tweets
text: energy bills climbed nearly 10 per cent higher than inflation since 2010 , damning new government statistics show

documents.title: estonia sees increase in 'e-residency ' applications from uk
text: estonia says it has seen a surge in uk tech entrepreneurs apply for its `` e-residency '' visa programme ahead of brexit .
launched in 2015 , the scheme allows anyone running an online business to become an official resident of estonia without having to move there .
e-residents can access government services to set up a company , open a bank account in estonia , and access the eu 's single market .
the estonian government says there had been 231 applications from the uk before last summer 's brexit vote , but that number has risen to 988 .

`` the uk may have chosen to leave the eu , but its entrepreneurs can still choose to remain inside the eu 's business environment , '' said kaspar korjus , managing director of the e-residency programme .
in total the programme has received about 15,000 applications from around the world .
according to statistics estonia , in 2016 the gross domestic product ( gdp ) of the country grew by 1.6 % compared with 2015 .

documents.title: uber reveals workforce diversity numbers
text: ride-hailing firm uber has published figures showing the diversity of its workforce .
the firm said it was `` no secret that we 're late to release these numbers '' .
and it thanked its `` employees for their tenacity in arguing the case for greater transparency - because what you do n't measure , you ca n't improve '' ,
the firm said it is committing $ 3m over the next three years to support organisations working to bring more women and underrepresented groups into technology .
it also said that at present 36.1 % of its global employees are women , with 15.4 % of its global technical staff women .
and currently 8.8 % of its us staff are black , and 5.6 % are hispanic .
earlier in the day the firm also said it was to pull put of denmark .

documents.title: yellen : banks must act to overcome unemployment
text: federal reserve chair janet yellen has said american banks must do more to promote economic development in low-income areas where high unemployment has persisted .
she said banks are needed not just to provide home mortgages in low and moderate-income areas , but also to support educational opportunities and boost small business development .
her remarks came in a speech in washington to the annual conference of the national community reinvestment coalition .

documents.title: thieves used wheelbarrow to steal £ 3.6m coin
text: as we reported yesterday , thieves stole a 100kg gold coin worth as much as £ 3.58m from a berlin museum on monday .
today , police revealed the suspects used a wheelbarrow to carry the coin , which is embossed with the head of queen elizabeth ii .
the `` big maple leaf '' coin was on loan to the bode museum 's coin collection .
berlin police say suspects used a wheelbarrow to make off with a 221-pound gold coin worth millions .

documents.title: us markets climb
text: all the major stock indices are climbing this afternoon in the us .
short while ago the dow jones was up 0.62 % at 20678.13 points , with banks jp morgan and goldman sachs gaining 1.6 % and 1.37 % respectively .
the s & p 500 also gained 0.62 % , to 2356.05 , while the nasdaq climbed 0.43 % to 5,865.50 .

documents.title: scotland referendum decision sends pound lower
text: a short while ago the scottish parliament backed nicola sturgeon 's call for a second referendum - and it appears to have hit the pound .
having already slipped ahead of the triggering of article 50 tomorrow , sterling is now 0.6 % lower against the dollar , at $ 1.24870 .
it 's also lower against the euro - down 0.3 % at 1.15230 euros .

documents.title: dublin 'best for bankers after brexit '
text: british bankers looking to relocate within the eu after brexit should head for dublin , according to the removals company movinga .
the firm ranked 10 eu cities for their suitability , based on factors such as rental costs , the top rate of tax , proximity to london , and even the number of burberry stores .
amsterdam and valletta in malta came second and third , with usual suspects frankfurt and paris ranking lower .
movinga also the best cities for start-ups looking to relocate , based on factors such capital availability , availability of co-working spaces , and shared rental costs .
amsterdam came top followed by warsaw and budapest .

documents.title: mccafferty unsure over raising borrowing costs
text: bank of england monetary policy committee ( mpc ) member ian mccafferty has said he does not know it he would vote to increase borrowing costs at the next mpc meeting in may .
`` the straight answer to that is i do n't know , '' he said in response to a question from a listener during a call-in on the london-based lbc radio station .

documents.title: 'scotland 's other drink'irn bru-maker ag barr releases financial results
text: on the bru : barr 's sales flat , profits have modest fizz , cutting down on sugar

documents.title: ftse 100 closes higher
text: the benchmark london index has closed higher after the pound slipped ahead of the triggering of article 50 on wednesday .
the ftse 100 gained 49.92 points , or 0.68 % , to 7,343.42 as the pound shed 0.33 % against the dollar to $ 1.25170 .
among the best performers was .
wolseley , up 5.37 % after the plumbing firm reported a big rise in profits .
bank .
standard chartered .
gained 3.98 % while publisher .
pearson .
was up 3.63 % .

documents.title: us consumer confidence 'hits 16-year-high '
text: investors may be in doubt about donald trump 's plans for the us economy , but consumers seem to be .
feeling confident .

according to a survey by the conference board , consumer confidence in the economy rose in march to its highest level since december 2000 , thanks to optimism about jobs growth and business conditions .
the conference board 's consumer confidence index registered 125.6 , beating economists ' expectations .
`` consumers ' assessment of current business and labour market conditions improved considerably , '' said lynn franco , director of economic indicators at the conference board .
`` consumers also expressed much greater optimism regarding the short-term outlook for business , jobs and personal income prospects . ''

documents.title: capital cities sign deal
text: london-paris business and tourism partnerships announced
i 'm still open to the bbc taking an interest in helping build # knowledgeeconomy p'ships using & .paris !

documents.title: uk-eu trade figures , a day before article 50 is triggeredthe ons tweets
text: more than half of uk trade in goods ( exports plus imports ) was with the eu in 2016

documents.title: moss bros profits jump
text: earlier today clothing outfitter moss bros said it was preparing for a tough year , as the collapse of sterling adds to `` significant '' cost pressures .

the suit retailer said the national living wage increase and the apprenticeship levy , as well as the `` combined effects of a devalued pound '' , would take their toll on the retail sector , which already faced `` one of the most highly competitive '' trading environments in recent history last year .
moss bros said its trading performance was in line with expectations and that early reaction to its spring and summer range has been `` positive '' .
the retailer reported pre-tax profits a fifth higher at £ 7.1m for the year to 28 january on a 5.7 % rise in revenue to £ 127.9m .
same-store sales jumped 5.3 % to £ 131.5m .

documents.title: wall street now slightly ahead
text: after beginning the day slightly down , wall street has moved equally tepidly in the other direction .
the benchmark dow was up 38 points , or 0.2 % , to 20,589 points , while the wider standard & poor 's 500 index added 3 points , or 0.2 % , to 2,345 .
and the nasdaq composite index gained 4 points , or 0.1 % , to 5,844 .

documents.title: samsung us move
text: samsung will not sell any refurbished galaxy note 7 smartphones in the united states .

on monday the south korean company said it would sell refurbished versions of the note 7 , which were permanently withdrawn from sale globally last year due to fire-prone batteries , in some markets .
samsung appears to have thought better of the decision for american customers at least , telling reuters it `` will not be offering refurbished galaxy note 7 devices for rent or sale in the us '' .

documents.title: ford announces investment in michigan plants
text: ford says it is investing $ 1.2bn ( £ 957m ) in three michigan facilities , including an engine plant where it plans to add 130 jobs .
it will spend $ 850m on its michigan assembly plant in wayne , $ 150m at its romeo engine plant , and $ 200m to build a data centre at its flat rock assembly plant .
the investments at the michigan and romeo plants were previously negotiated as part of the 2015 ford-united auto workers union contract .
president donald trump backed ford 's move in a tweet on tuesday .
in january the carmaker scrapped plans to build a $ 1.6bn car factory in mexico after criticism from the president .

documents.title: us home prices rise faster than expected
text: us single-family home prices jumped in january from a year earlier , at the fastest pace since july 2014 .
the standard & poor 's corelogic case-shiller 20-city home price index increased by 5.7 % .
a tight supply of houses for sale had spurred house bidding wars in many cities .

documents.title: wall street opens slightly down
text: at open on tuesday the benchmark dow jones industrial average was down 16.24 points , or 0.08 % , at 20,534.74 , the wider s & p 500 was down 1.8 points , or 0.07 % , at 2,339.79 and the tech-based nasdaq was down 2.92 points , or 0.05 % , at 5,837.45 .

documents.title: tesco 'committed ' to booker deal
text: supermarket giant tesco has hit back at criticism of its planned £ 3.7bn ( $ 4.7bn ) takeover of wholesaler booker .

tesco 's third and fourth largest investors - schroders and artisan partners - who together hold 9 % of its equity , say the retailer is overpaying for booker , and that the deal is an unwanted distraction .
`` we 're absolutely , completely committed to the deal , '' tesco chief executive dave lewis said on tuesday .
`` since we made the announcement i 've met tens of shareholders , here and in north america , and i 'm really pleased with the response that we 've got . ''
he said tesco was in the early stages of taking over booker , with the deal still to be formally considered by competition authorities .
it that does not prove to be a stumbling block , the deal would then need to be approved by 50 % of tesco shareholders .

documents.title: weetabix sale looms
text: the telegraph is reporting that weetabix is set to be bought by an american cereal maker as soon as this week .
the uk 's second-biggest cereal brand was sold to china 's bright food five years ago for £ 1.2bn , but it has failed to catch consumers ' taste buds .

new york-listed post holdings , which makes cereals including fruity pebbles and cinnamon toasters , is said to be the front runner after other bidders dropped out of an action , according to the telegraph .

documents.title: ftse flounders
text: both the ftse 100 and the 250 are treading water in afternoon trading .
one winner is the aa , up almost 5 % , which hargreaves lansdown analyst nicholas hyett says reflects good news from its roadside assistance division .
`` the group has managed to reverse long-standing trends by reporting growth in member numbers .
with retention rates on the rise too , these results mark an important milestone in its turnaround plan .
there is still plenty of work to be done , however , '' he says .
meanwhile , the decision by private equity firm jc flowers to sell a 10 % stake in onesavings has sent shares in the bank down 6.4 % .
flowers remains a 40 % -plus shareholder , however , so there could be further sales to come , hyett adds .

documents.title: tencent takes tesla stake
text: tesla shares are set to open higher in new york after chinese tech giant tencent holdings revealed a 5 % stake in the electric car maker that cost it about $ 1.8bn ( £ 1.4bn ) .
tencent , best known for its wechat mobile app , has been investing in a number of sectors , including gaming , entertainment , cloud computing and online financing .
it is now the fifth-largest shareholder in tesla .
chief executive elon musk ( has a stake of just over a fifth .
tesla shares have risen more than 18 % in the past 12 months .

documents.title: ericsson books $ 1.7bn costs
text: sweden 's ericsson will book up to $ 1.7bn in writedowns and restructuring costs in the first quarter as it battles to turn its ailing business around .
the telecoms giant faces a slowdown in its main markets and mounting competition from mobile providers huawei and nokia .
its sales slipped 11 % in 2016 .
`` restoring profitability is key and we will start by focusing the portfolio to fewer areas and securing effectiveness and efficiency in operations , '' the firm said .
ericsson shares fell 4.6 % on tuesday before regaining ground .
they have lost a quarter of their value in the last 12 months .

documents.title: square eyes
text: square , the payments processing service , is coming to the uk .
it will compete against izettle , sumup and more elaborate till systems .
the man behind the product - twitter chief jack dorsey - explains why the expansion comes more than eight years after square 's us debut .

documents.title: tesco : the dpa way
text: a deferred prosecution agreement ( dpa ) is a fairly new way of punishing a company for criminal behaviour without the collateral damage of a conviction .
for example , sanctions or reputational damage that could put the company out of business and destroy the jobs and investments of innocent people .

this potential dpa with tesco stores limited does not address whether liability of any sort attaches to tesco plc or any employee or agent of tesco plc or tesco stores ltd. dpas may be fairly new , but they are instruments the sfo is warming to .
just last month it announced a dpa with rolls-royce which saw the company pay a uk fine of £ 500m .

in that case , the judge agreed that a criminal conviction for the company could disbar it from securing contracts - particularly in the us - which in turn could threaten the jobs of thousands of uk workers .
a dpa also avoids lengthy and costly trials and puts the offending company on probation to ensure full co-operation in the future .
read simon 's full analysis here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: trade unions 'will have to adapt'business committee
text: labour mp peter kyle says agency staff are `` one of the most disempowered groups '' in the uk and raises his `` frustrations '' with the situation of agency staff in the sports direct warehouse in shirebrook .
steve turner says trade unions must `` adapt '' and find ways to `` best represent '' people in the changing economy .

the assistant general secretary of unite tells the committee he is `` in dialogue with mike ashley '' and quips that he is `` hopeful '' of being able to sit in this committee alongside mr ashley to discuss about what an `` exemplary employer '' he has become .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: sports direct agency transline have 'revamped ' contractsbusiness committee
text: transline 's jennifer hardy , the employment agency which staffs sports direct 's warehouse in shirebrook , tells mp michelle donelan that their `` contracts have been revamped '' .
ms hardy says these new contracts `` make it easier for workers to understand what they are getting into '' .
in september 2016 , the business committee called on sports direct owner mike ashley to end the company 's ties with transline , who are used to supply workers to its warehouse in derbyshire .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: tory mp asks about accident insurance for agency workersbusiness committee
text: conservative mp antoinette sandbach asks about personal accident insurance for agency workers .

adrian gregory of extraman ltd ( a recruitment agency specialising in the placement of industrial and construction staff ) says agencies often take out personal accident insurance policies and then sell them to their workforce on a subscription basis .
mr gregory said these policies retail at `` as low a £ 1.50 per annum '' for agencies and can be charged at £ 125 per annum to agency workers .
mr gregory said this is a `` a scam '' and a reason for agencies to make a profit .
read more about this issue here .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: flotations falling flat
text: the value of listings on uk stock markets in the first three months of 2017 fell 28 % against the same quarter last year , and are at the lowest level since 2012 .
data from thomson reuters shows initial public offerings ( ipos ) raised $ 1.53bn during the period .
that contrasts with the rest of the world .
proceeds from ipos have more than doubled in the year-to-date compared with 2016 , totalling $ 29.4bn .
thomson reuters said there have been more fresh stock market listings so far this year globally than any other year-to-date period since 2000 , with 302 offerings priced .

documents.title: tesco maths lesson
text: some handy explanation from laith khalaf at hargreaves lansdown about the compensation calculation for tesco shareholders .

`` the gap between the closing share price on 19th september and 22nd september is being taken as the basis for the compensation payment of 24.5p , as this was when the market was judged to have absorbed the news of the profit overstatement , following tesco putting its hand in the air on the morning of the 22nd , '' he says .
`` on the face of it this would give rise to a compensation payment of 27p .
however , the ftse 100 also fell on 22 september , from 6,838 to 6,774 .

after adjusting the tesco share price to factor out this 1 % fall , so as to give a more accurate reading of the effect of the accounting correction rather than wider market noise , the 24.5p compensation therefore looks about right . ''

documents.title: workers 'forced ' to take insecure contracts
text: more from the business committee .
labour mp anna turley says that being an agency worker is `` not a choice '' and people are `` forced to take '' less secure and less well-paid contracts , referencing her teesside constituency .
steve turner of unite says being an agency worker often contributes to in-work poverty as the roles are so insecure .
david camp of the association of labour providers says agency roles are mostly filled by migrant workers and that agency work is a `` ready and accessible route into work '' for many people .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: souq sold
text: amazon is buying the middle east 's largest online retailer , souq.com , for an undisclosed sum .
the deal comes a day after dubai-based emaar malls said it had offered $ 800m for souq .
amazon abandoned talks with the online retailer earlier this year after reportedly offering $ 650m .

documents.title: gig economy hearing
text: the commons business committee is examining the status and rights of agency workers , the self-employed and those working in the `` gig economy '' .
the inquiry , chaired by labour mp iain wright , is also looking at issues such as low-pay and poor working conditions for those in non-traditional employee roles .
lindsay judge of the resolution foundation says agency workers are an `` expanding group '' , now making up about 3 % of the workforce .
she says agency workers are concentrated within the manufacturing , business activities ( such as it consulting ) and the public sector .
ms judge notes that agency workers are `` not all in low-end '' jobs , and that they are widely dispersed across the economy .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: uber departs denmark
text: uber is pulling out of denmark because of the country 's new taxi law , it announced today .
the ride-hailing firm will end its services on 18 april .
the law requires taxis to have seat sensors , video surveillance and taxi meters among other stipulations .
uber has clashed with danish cabbies and regulators since starting operations in copenhagen in 2014 .
in november the danish high court upheld the conviction of six uber drivers who were found guilty of violating taxi laws and were each fined as much as £ 700 .

documents.title: uswitch rejects sun claims
text: uswitch has defended its service after the sun claimed consumers were not being shown the best deals .
the price comparison site said it was testing its website in line with regulator proposals after a report said the cheapest prices were initially hidden in searches .
according to the sun , consumers were shown deals from companies that had paid uswitch for promotion , with the best deals only revealed when a box was ticked on the search page .

a uswitch spokesman said its methods were in line with ofgem proposals : `` throughout the trial all customers have been able to easily see all energy deals available on the market with one click . ''
comparison sites are required to comply with rules introduced by the regulator in 2014 to receive accreditation .

documents.title: scraping by
text: spare a thought for aviva chief executive mark wilson .
he was paid a mere £ 4.35m last year - down from £ 5.44m in 2015 - according to the insurer 's annual report .
his fixed pay accounted for a third of the total , with the annual bonus making up 42 % and the rest from shares under the long-term incentive plan ( ltip ) .
more detail on page 106 if you really care .

documents.title: ftse 100 update
text: wolseley remains the stand-out leader on an otherwise lacklustre day so far for the ftse 100 .
the building materials group is up more than 6 % after reporting a big rise in profits .
randgold , down 1.5 % , is the biggest faller despite the gold miner 's bullish update on trading prospects .
the ftse 100 is up 0.05 % at 7,296.7 points .
the ftse 250 is also virtually flat , down just 0.08 % at 18,885.4 .

documents.title: german fears
text: we mentioned earlier that chinese firms still have faith in the uk post-brexit , but others closer to home are less certain .

britain 's departure from the eu will significantly hurt german firms ' business with the united kingdom and investment will decline strongly in the long term , says the president of germany 's dihk chambers of commerce .

four in ten companies expect business to weaken , dihk president eric schweitzer said a day before britain triggers article 50 : `` we should expect further declines in trade in the coming months . ''
nearly one in ten companies was already planning to withdraw investment from the uk even though the terms of brexit were not yet known , he adds .

documents.title: 'serious consequences ' for ladbrokes coral
text: the boss of ladbrokes coral said today that things are going well at the newly merged firm , with profits and revenues up .
but analyst nicholas hyett , of hargreaves lansdown , says it wo n't be all plain sailing for britain 's biggest bookie , which perhaps explains why the shares are down 1.7 % .
he 's particularly concerned about the government 's pending review of fixed-odd betting terminals .

`` as the uk 's largest high street bookmaker the group has the greatest exposure to gaming machines reforms that undermine profitability , such as significantly reducing the amounts that can be staked at any one time , would have serious consequences for the group , '' mr hyett says .

he adds : `` these results included reassurance that the review would be 'evidence-based ' , but the issue is highly political and recent regulatory reforms elsewhere in the gambling industry have been more severe than the group had expected . ''

documents.title: inside your head
text: north america technology correspondent dave lee tweets :
the world 's most interesting man strikes again .
musk wants to stick tiny electrodes into your brain .
i 'd let him .
it would be a definite improvement
you 'd let him ? ? ? ? ? ?

documents.title: fall in sterling after brexit vote hits virgin atlantic
text: virgin atlantic has reported a 2 % rise in annual pretax profits to £ 23m after originally forecasting a big rise for 2016 .
the airline said the fall in sterling following the brexit vote affected both revenues and profits last year .
since delta bought its 49 % stake in 2013 , virgin has put a new emphasis on transatlantic routes , although capacity will be trimmed by 1 % this year .
`` the uk has never been a better bargain , '' said chief executive craig kreeger .
`` we are selling much more agressively to foreign points of sale .
but even that feels like it wo n't be enough , '' he says .
`` we have competed agressively on price .
our goal is to make sure we are as efficient an airline as we can be . ''

documents.title: coining it
text: business journalist clare matheson has emptied the 5 live piggy bank
if you 've ever wondered what £ 85k pouring out of a bag looks like , wonder no more @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid reminds me of my brother 's stash !
can @ twitterid swim in it like scrooge mcduck ?
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: potholes need plugging
text: one in six roads across england and wales is in such a bad state that it must be repaired within the next five years , according to local authorities .
the annual local authority road maintenance survey found that 17 % of roads were in `` poor '' condition .

the government is planning to invest £ 1.2bn in roads this year , which includes repair and maintenance , but authorities say it will take an average of 12 years and £ 12bn to bring the local network `` up to scratch '' .

councillor judith blake , from the local government association , said : `` local authorities fixed a pothole every 19 seconds again last year despite significant budget reductions , leaving them with less to spend on fixing our crumbling roads .

`` councils are proving remarkably efficient in how they use this diminishing funding pot but they remain trapped in a frustrating cycle that will only ever leave them able to patch up our deteriorating roads . ''

documents.title: 'big slap on the wrist '
text: laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says the £ 129m fine and £ 85m compensation scheme is a `` big slap on the wrist for tesco '' that reflects the seriousness of the offence and its impact on the share price in 2014 .
`` investors will be pleased that compensation is now going to be issued to those who bought shares in the supermarket at an inflated price , based on false information , '' he says .

`` this kind of accounting error is exceptionally rare in the uk stock market , nonetheless shareholders in all companies will be heartened to learn that in instances where false information is provided to the market , the regulator will see to it that investors are duly compensated .
`` dave lewis underwent a baptism of fire when he took over as ceo in 2014 , just as the accounting scandal struck .
he and the supermarket will now be hoping to draw a line under the matter , and concentrate on nurturing tesco 's nascent recovery . ''

documents.title: on the road again
text: it 's day 2 of our a50 roadtrip and @ twitterid is at a hotel in the east midlands finding out what # brexit means for british businesses
shame , that as expected , we only get a pro eu program from a bias bbc .
about time the bbc got behind brexit
not impressed with digby jones ' 'remoaner ' spiel - another peer demeaning people who oppose him with insults .
# a50 means choosing isolation instead of cooperation
does make you wonder how they managed before free movement of people
totally distracted by that terrible awful foul wallpaper .
# norefurbishmentsince1983
good interview with lord digby jones , first person i have heard taking a lot of sense , well done steph .
if , as digby jones states , there will be no change .
why do they have to remove my rights to achieve stasis ?
digby 's dinner assures corporate service industry will have a good supply of servants to serve at banquet for the rich piggy 's
unity well brexitiers should stop ranting n insulting remainers as remoaners bullying ranting old ppl
rubbish digby claptrap commonwealth ?
aussies already negotiating with ireland so got a foothold in eu

documents.title: staycation trend not hurting thomas cook
text: the weakening pound and security concerns about travelling abroad was supposed to put a dampener on the summer holiday market , but thomas cook is starting to see a rise in bookings .
the holiday operator says in a trading update that summer bookings are up 10 % on last year , and that tourists are beginning to return to turkey and egypt .
admittedly , this is from a low base , but thomas cook says demand is looking `` strong '' .
uk bookings are flat , the company adds .
shares are down 0.4 % at 89p .

documents.title: ag barr profits fizz higher
text: scotland business editor douglas fraser has been taking a look at ag barr 's results :
irn bru maker ag barr year to jan 31 : revnu flat at £ 257m pre-tax profit +4 % to £ 43m shed 100 staff shift to low sugar brands continues
come on douglas , you 're dying to say it `` irn bru loses fizz ''

documents.title: breakingftse opens higher
text: the london market has done better than yesterday 's stumble , managing a 0.25 % rise to 7,313 points as trading begins .
despite its £ 129m fine , tesco shares are down just 0.4 % at 189.1p , meaning they are virtually flat over the past 12 months .

documents.title: tesco 's booker bid : 'it was time to go public ' with concerns , says schroders
text: the other big tesco story of the day is the growing shareholder opposition to its planned £ 3.7bn purchase of booker .
schroders fund manager nick kirrage has gone public with his concerns , saying that private talks with tesco fell on deaf ears .
tesco said that it was committed to going ahead , mr kirrage tells today .
so schroders decided to go public to raise awareness and see if other shareholders had concerns .
`` it opens up the debate about the risk and price being paid , '' he says .
mr kirrage adds that tesco 's recovery is well underway and he does not want to see that jeopardised .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: tesco 'doing the right thing '
text: tesco 's agreement with the financial conduct authority to a finding of market abuse relates to the company 's trading statement announced on 29 august 2014 .
it contained the inflated profit figures , which arose from incorrect accounting practices .

`` the fca has expressly stated that it is not suggesting that the tesco plc board of directors knew , or could reasonably be expected to have known , that the information contained in that trading statement was false or misleading . ''
andrew bailey , fca chief executive , said : tesco and its board are doing the right thing here , taking appropriate responsibility and agreeing to rectify the consequences of the misconduct .
they have cooperated fully with us and this sets a good example for the market and so is a good outcome for tesco and investors . ''
it is the first time the watchdog has used its powers to make a listed company pay compensation for market abuse .

documents.title: wolseley in name-change as us profits jump
text: heating and plumbing products supplier wolseley reported a 25 % rise in first-half profit , as growth in the us more than made up for tough trading conditions in the uk and the nordic countries
the company plans to change its name to ferguson , its top brand in its largest market , the us , where it makes about 84 % of its profit .
group trading profit rose to £ 515m in the six months ending 31 january from £ 412m a year ago .
revenue rose 24.5 % to £ 8.46bn , while like-for-like revenue grew 3.2 % year-on-year , and wolseley said like-for-like revenue had grown about 4.5 % since the end of the period .

documents.title: ladbrokes coral : 'a successful start '
text: ladbrokes coral insists the merger of the two bookies is going well .
combined revenues are up 11 % to £ 2.35bn , while operating profits rose 22 % to £ 264m .
chief executive jim mullen called it `` a very successful start '' .
a government review into the industry means there is `` some short term uncertainty '' .
that aside , the business is strong and the future looks bright , he insists .

documents.title: tesco shareholder compensation
text: the compensation scheme is to make up the difference in price of tesco shares and bonds between the close of trading on friday 19 september 2014 and the market re-opening on monday 22 september .
that was the morning tesco announced it had identified an overstatement of its expected profit , causing its share price to plunge .
kpmg will run the scheme , with oversight from the financial conduct authority .
further details are available on the tesco website .

documents.title: redrow ends bovis pursuit
text: uk housebuilder redrow has ended its pursuit of rival bovis .
redrow had been competing with galliford try in a battle for bovis , but said in a statement .
that it is not in its shareholders ' best interests to increase its proposal '' above its previous offer .

documents.title: lewis : 'sincere regret '
text: the serious fraud office said that in the two and a half years since its investigation was announced , tesco had made `` extensive changes to leadership , structures , financial controls , partnerships with suppliers , and the way the business buys and sells '' .
dave lewis , tesco chief executive , said : `` we have fully cooperated with this investigation into historic accounting practices , while at the same time fundamentally transforming our business .
we sincerely regret the issues which occurred in 2014 and we are committed to doing everything we can to continue to restore trust in our business and brand . ''

documents.title: breakingtesco agreements
text: tesco has struck a deferred prosecution agreement with the serious fraud office following its investigation into the supermarket 's overstatement of profits in 2014 by £ 263m .
the inflated profit figure was the result of tesco bringing forward rebates from suppliers .
tesco has also agreed with the financial conduct authority to set up a compensation scheme for shareholders that will cost an estimated £ 85m .
more in the statement here .

documents.title: franchise is 'no gamble '
text: first group ( along with china 's mtr ) yesterday won the right to run the south west trains franchise .
first is promising to pay back £ 2.6bn over seven years to taxpayers , but chief executive tim o'toole says it is not taking some big gamble .
the franchise - centered on services to and from waterloo - `` generates a lot of revenue '' .
if you make `` sensible '' bids rail can be a great business , he tells today .
mr o'toole also says first wants to deal with unions in a `` progressive '' manner .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: breakingtesco fined £ 129m
text: tesco has agreed to pay a £ 129m fine in a deal with the serious fraud office in relation to overstating its profits .

documents.title: thought-provoking
text: billionaire tesla founder elon musk is taking a step into science fiction .
he is launching a company that he hopes will merge computers with the human brain .

the creation of neuralink corp , first reported in the wall street journal , will pursue what musk calls `` neural lace '' technology - implanting tiny brain electrodes that might one day enable the uploading and downloading of thoughts .

documents.title: gross and pimco settle feud
text: a feud that has gripped the normally sober world of bond investing looks to have been resolved .
billionaire bill gross , founder of the world 's biggest bond investor pimco , has reached a roughly $ 81m ( £ 65m ) settlement of his lawsuit that followed his departure from the firm .
gross and pimco said in a joint statement the settlement was `` amicable , '' and that pimco will donate the proceeds to charity .
gross added that `` pimco has always been family to me , and , like any family , sometimes there are disagreements . ''

documents.title: china in 'action mode '
text: qatar was making headlines yesterday for its vow to invest billions in the british economy .
however , james sassoon , chairman of the china-britain business council , tells today that china `` is in action mode '' , with a quarter of its investment in europe last year coming to the uk .
the hinkley point nuclear power deal - despite some wobbles - was an important sign that the uk remains open for business with china , lord sassoon says .
the chinese government has `` made a bet on the city of london '' , he adds .
can there be a free trade deal between china and uk ?
that will be tough to achieve , but it is important to aim for one , according to lord sassoon .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: watch : a brief history of decimal coins
text: on the day the new £ 1 coin is introduced , here 's some fast facts on the history of decimal coins .

documents.title: another tesco investor criticises booker takeover plan
text: the financial times is reporting that a second tesco shareholder , artisan partners , has publicly criticised the supermarket 's £ 3.7bn bid for booker .
the ft quotes artisan manager daniel o'keefe , who says tesco is still recovering from the `` train wreck '' of the past few years .

although new management is simplifyng and refocusing the business , he tells the ft : `` we just do n't understand in a business as fragile as retail why on earth would we risk distracting ourselves from that huge goal . ''
investor schroders had already come out against the booker deal .

documents.title: aa ties up with china southern
text: american airlines and china 's biggest carrier by passengers , china southern , have agreed a strategic partnership .
the us airline will buy $ 200m ( £ 159m ) worth of shares in the chinese firm and the two will `` seek to increase cooperation '' .
the deal should offer american airlines more opportunities to tap into china 's growing aviation market .
chinese carriers have been aggressively expanding their fleets and boosting international destinations to cater for a strong growth in outbound chinese travel .
china is one of the biggest sources of tourists to the us .
china southern is the last of china 's three major airlines to bring in a strategic investor from outside mainland china .
hong kong 's cathay pacific holds about 18 % in flag carrier air china , while us airline delta bought a 3.6 % stake in china eastern in 2015 .

documents.title: £ 1 coin : 'business has had three years to get ready '
text: the boss of the royal mint , adam lawrence , has been on wake up to money talking about the introduction of the new £ 1 coin .
despite criticism from some businesses that the changeover is too swift , he insists that the majority of companies wanted a quick introduction .
`` companies have had three years to get ready , '' he says .
another criticism has been that the whole process is unnecessary .
counterfeiting had become such a big problem that it was time to act , mr lawrence says .
about one in 40 existing £ 1 coins are thought to be fake .
one of the biggest sources of counterfeits in recent years has been a `` dutch mint '' , but there 's not too much he 's allowed to say about that .
`` a lot [ of counterfeits ] have come from overseas , '' is all he will add .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: asian shares move higher
text: japanese shares moved higher on tuesday as the yen weakened against the us dollar .
a weaker currency usually boosts the shares of the export sector , crucial to japan 's economy .
the nikkei 225 is higher by 1 % , with most of the country 's carmakers and tech companies seeing a similar increase .
in china , the shanghai composite .
is lower by 0.3 % while hong kong 's hang seng is trading 0.5 % up .
investors seem divided about what to make of the deal between china southern and american airlines - shares in china 's biggest carrier by passengers were up in shanghai but down in hong kong .
in australia , the asx 200 jumped 1.2 % while in south korea , the kospi is flat .

documents.title: qatar 's £ 5bn : investment or speculation ?
text: qatar 's announcement that it plans to invest another £ 5bn in the uk .
has been greeted as a vote of confidence in britain .
david stubbs , global market strategist at jp morgan asset management , agrees that it underlines the health of the economy .
but he tells wake up to money that the word `` investment '' is thrown around `` too loosely '' .
if the money is going into new transport or building infrastructure , then that 's real investment .
but if qatar is buying up existing assets - as happened with harrods ( above ) - then that 's more like speculation .
`` i 'm not sure how the money is going to be spent , '' he says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

text: good morning and welcome to tuesday 's business livepage .
we 'll be keeping a close eye on the markets after a few wobbles lately .
there are full-year profit figures from ladbrokes coral and the aa , and expect more developments in the growing shareholder opposition to tesco 's takeover of booker .
oh , and in case you 've missed it , the new £ 1 goes in to circulation today .
please stay with us for all the breaking business news .
